Package be.geertvanderpijpen.thinkinginjava.exercises.initializationandcleanup

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArrayConstruction  
    ArrayMember  
    ArrayOfStrings
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Initializes a String array and prints all elements
    Burrito
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A burrito has one property: Spiciness
    3 burritos are created and a description of their spiciness is printed
    CurrenciesDescription
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Lists the PaperCurrencies enumerator values by color
    DefaultConstructor
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A class is created that contains a default constructor
    The default constructor contains a print statement
    A new instance of the class is created.
    DefaultConstructorInstance  
    Dog
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Dog class that contains different overloaded bark methods
    The print statements show what method is used
    EnumOrder
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Uses the Spiciness enumerator to domonstrate how to find out the declaration order in an enum
    ExampleString  
    FinalizeDemonstration
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the cleanup of Java objects
    Note that the garbage collector does not seem to clean up the one created object
    FinalizeObject  
    FinalizeTank
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Finalize demonstrated by a Tank example.
    InitializedStringValue
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates that a class member that is initialized at definition time gets the correct value
    A String class member is initialized at definition time.
    InitStringValue  
    LoopCurrencies
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Loops all the currencies defined in PaperCurrencies and prints their ordinality
    MethodCalls
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates that method calls within the same class can be done with or without the use of this, as long as the methods are not static
    NoConstructor
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A class with no explicit constructor and an integer member field is instantiated
    The integer member field is then printed to prove that an implicit constructor has been called
    NoConstructorInstance  
    NonStaticInitialization
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates non-static initialization using a class with a String member field
    OverloadedConstructor
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A class is created that contains a default constructor
    The default constructor contains a print statement
    The constructor is overloaded with a String argument
    Both constructors are called with the print statements proving that they are really used
    A new instance of the class is created.
    OverloadedConstructorInstance  
    OverloadedConstructors
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Overload constructors and call one constructor from the other using this
    SimpleEnumUse
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    shows simple use of the Spiciness enumerator
    StaticString
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Uses a class with 2 static String fields
    One field is initialized at declaration time
    The other field is initialized during static initialization block
    Displays show that the fields are initialized before they are accessed the first time
    StringHolder  
    StringValue  
    Tank  
    UninitializedString
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates that an unitialized String member is initialized to null by Java
    The String class member is not given an initialization value
    It's value is then printed in the constructor
    VarArgString
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows the use of VarArgs method arguments
    In a regular member method In the main method
  • Enum Summary

    PaperCurrencies
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Contains the 6 least valuable euro bills

    Different types of Spiciness
